H.text: A Canadian judge acquitted two Sikhs of killing 331 people in the bombings of an Air India plane and at a Tokyo airport
H.ref: A Canadian judge acquitted two Indian-born Sikhs of killing 331 people two decades ago in the bombings of an Air India plane over the Atlantic and a Tokyo airport.

H.text: A Canadian judge acquitted two Sikh men accused of murdering 329 people in an Air India jet bombing.
H.ref: A Canadian judge on Wednesday acquitted two Sikh men accused of murdering 329 people in an Air India jet bombing off the coast of Ireland in 1985.

H.text: A Canadian judge announced that Ripudaman Singh Malik was not guilty of conspiracy.
H.ref: A Canadian judge announced Wednesday that Sikh businessman Ripudaman Singh Malik and sawmill worker Ajaib Singh Bagri were not guilty of conspiracy and murder in the 1985 Air India bombing that killed 329 people.

H.text: A Canadian judge announced that Ripudaman Singh Malik was not guilty of murder.
H.ref: A Canadian judge announced Wednesday that Sikh businessman Ripudaman Singh Malik and sawmill worker Ajaib Singh Bagri were not guilty of conspiracy and murder in the 1985 Air India bombing that killed 329 people.

H.text: A Canadian judge announced that Ajaib Singh Bagri was not guilty of murder.
H.ref: A Canadian judge announced Wednesday that Sikh businessman Ripudaman Singh Malik and sawmill worker Ajaib Singh Bagri were not guilty of conspiracy and murder in the 1985 Air India bombing that killed 329 people.

H.text: A Canadian judge announced that Ajaib Singh Bagri was not guilty of conspiracy.
H.ref: A Canadian judge announced Wednesday that Sikh businessman Ripudaman Singh Malik and sawmill worker Ajaib Singh Bagri were not guilty of conspiracy and murder in the 1985 Air India bombing that killed 329 people.

H.text: There was an Air India bombing in 1985.
H.ref: A Canadian judge on Wednesday acquitted two Sikh men accused of murdering 329 people in an Air India jet bombing off the coast of Ireland in 1985.

H.text: Air India Flight 182 was brought down by a bomb.
H.ref: Ripudaman Singh Malik was found not guilty Wednesday in the deaths of 329 people who perished when Air India Flight 182 was brought down by a bomb 20 years ago in Canada's worst case of mass murder.

H.text: 331 people were killed in the bombings of an Air India plane and at Tokyo's airport.
H.ref: After a two-year trial, a Canadian judge on Wednesday acquitted two Indian-born Sikhs of murder and other charges in the deaths of 331 people killed in the bombings of an Air India plane over the Atlantic and at Tokyo's airport 20 years ago.

H.text: The Air India bombing killed 329 people.
H.ref: A Canadian judge announced Wednesday that Sikh businessman Ripudaman Singh Malik and sawmill worker Ajaib Singh Bagri were not guilty of conspiracy and murder in the 1985 Air India bombing that killed 329 people.

H.text: Two Sikh men were accused of murdering 329 people in an Air India bombing in 1985.
H.ref: A Canadian judge on Wednesday acquitted two Sikh men accused of murdering 329 people in an Air India jet bombing off the coast of Ireland in 1985.

H.text: Two Sikhs were cleared of killing 329 people in an Air India jet.
H.ref: Venomous demands for justice besieged Canada's government Thursday, after two Sikhs were cleared of killing 329 people in a 1985 Air India jet bombing.

H.text: Ian Bruce Josephson said the prosecution's witnesses were not credible.
H.ref: British Columbia Supreme Court Justice Ian Josephson said the prosecution's witnesses were not credible.

H.text: A bomb exploded at Narita airport.
H.ref: An hour earlier, a bomb in baggage intended for another Air India flight exploded in the Tokyo airport, killing two baggage handlers.

H.text: A bomb exploded killing two baggage handlers.
H.ref: An hour earlier, a bomb in baggage intended for another Air India flight exploded in the Tokyo airport, killing two baggage handlers.

H.text: Two baggage handlers were killed while transferring suitcases to an Air India Flight.
H.ref: Just 54 minutes earlier, another bomb had exploded at Japan's Narita airport, killing two baggage handlers transferring suitcases to Air India Flight 201.

H.text: Ajaib Singh Bagri had faced charges of murder and conspiracy.
H.ref: Justice Ian Josephson was still to pass judgment on Ajaib Singh Bagri, 55, who along with Malik had faced charges of first-degree murder, conspiracy to commit murder and attempted murder in the downing of Flight 182.

H.text: Ripudaman Singh Malik had faced charges of murder and conspiracy.
H.ref: Justice Ian Josephson was still to pass judgment on Ajaib Singh Bagri, 55, who along with Malik had faced charges of first-degree murder, conspiracy to commit murder and attempted murder in the downing of Flight 182.

H.text: Ripudaman Singh Malik was found not guilty in the deaths of 329 people.
H.ref: Ripudaman Singh Malik was found not guilty Wednesday in the deaths of 329 people who perished when Air India Flight 182 was brought down by a bomb 20 years ago in Canada's worst case of mass murder.

H.text: Ripudaman Singh Malik denied involvement in the bombings.
H.ref: The two defendants, Ripudaman Singh Malik and Ajaib Singh Bagri, were proponents of a separate Sikh state, but they denied involvement in the bombings.

H.text: Ripudaman Singh Malik immigrated to Canada from Punjab.
H.ref: Malik and Bagri, orthodox Sikhs who immigrated to Canada from Punjab, were accused of conspiring to plant suitcase bombs on two aircraft.

H.text: Ripudaman Singh Malik is a millionaire.
Ajaib Singh Bagri is a mill worker.
H.ref: Bagri arrived in Canada in 1968, according to court documents, and was a mill worker.

H.text: Ripudaman Singh Malik is a businessman.
H.ref: A Canadian judge announced Wednesday that Sikh businessman Ripudaman Singh Malik and sawmill worker Ajaib Singh Bagri were not guilty of conspiracy and murder in the 1985 Air India bombing that killed 329 people.

H.text: Ajaib Singh Bagri is 55.
H.ref: Loved ones of victims gasped in shock, as the judge threw out eight counts of murder and conspiracy each against Ajaib Singh Bagri, 55, and Ripudaman Singh Malik, 58.

H.text: Ian Bruce Josephson is a judge.
H.ref: Justice Ian Josephson was still to pass judgment on Ajaib Singh Bagri, 55, who along with Malik had faced charges of first-degree murder, conspiracy to commit murder and attempted murder in the downing of Flight 182.

H.text: Ajaib Singh Bagri was proponent of a separate Sikh state.
H.ref: The two defendants, Ripudaman Singh Malik and Ajaib Singh Bagri, were proponents of a separate Sikh state, but they denied involvement in the bombings.

H.text: Ajaib Singh Bagri immigrated to Canada from Punjab.
H.ref: Malik and Bagri, orthodox Sikhs who immigrated to Canada from Punjab, were accused of conspiring to plant suitcase bombs on two aircraft.

H.text: Ajaib Singh Bagri denied involvement in the bombings.
H.ref: The two defendants, Ripudaman Singh Malik and Ajaib Singh Bagri, were proponents of a separate Sikh state, but they denied involvement in the bombings.
